tweets.text:
At Health Questions I asked @MattHancock about the public health implications of the breaches at Walley's Quarry.

I know, from both the local GPs and those writing to me, that many residents are concerned for their health, both physically and mentally. @PHE_uk @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/pwh6zUI4Zs

tweets.text: Thank you for raising this Aaron. Both @PHE_uk and @EnvAgencyMids need to have more urgency in their effort and actions to stop the stink and to reassure local people re health  implications. https://t.co/T2B2okOHA8
@SaveLeaMarshes @EnvAgency @EnvAgencySE Just reported it and it took 18 minutes! How is there not a simple form for me to fill in online?
@RiversReturn @EnvAgency @natural_course @GroundworkGM @FarmersGuardian @NFUtweets @GMGreenCity What are they going to do with the midden - does it get used for fertiliser?

tweets.text:
Have you ever seen #sewage fungus? 

Our reporter got up close to it for tonight‚Äôs programme, ‚ÄòThe River Pollution Scandal.‚Äô

Don‚Äôt miss it on @BBCOne at 7:40pm.

#BBCPanorama https://t.co/k8KSoiRIpN

Anyone know why builders at Mitcham Bridge are dumping waste into the River Wandle? I recorded this today at 3:15. #wandle @EnvAgencySE  @EnvAgency @riverlevel_2135 @Merton_Council https://t.co/czmoLpKGHd
@markroffey @SaveLeaMarshes @EnvAgency @EnvAgencySE That's a very good question. It's a clunky system. Did they give you a reference number?
Thank you to every one signing this petition as yesterday when I signed it was just over 100 & now over 1000üëçNo moreüí©in our rivers @EnvAgency @WaterUK ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
@markroffey @EnvAgency @LDNWaterkeeper Foul ü§¢ (Not that they will be interested, but have you reported to @EnvAgencySE ?)

@WHO  @EnvAgency In Newcastle under Lyme we can‚Äôt breath fresh air, we are being poisoned in our own homes by @RedIndustries2 ‚Äòs poor management at walleys quarry landfill @StinkStopthe https://t.co/TuaWkxoAKw
@WasteCrimeWatch @EnvAgency NRW investigation in Wales.

tweets.text: Another rare chalk stream (Ravensbourne) being destroyed whilst @EnvAgency does what. This type of event now so routine. What is point of @JamesBevanEA ? @Meg_HillierMP @AquiferChalk @Thames21 @Thames_RvrsTrst @Feargal_Sharkey https://t.co/hWurzHhBZa

We‚Äôve also been supporting a growing army of volunteers who are helping to clean up their own neighbourhoods. 

Since January we‚Äôve supplied almost 400 litter pickers and over 7500 black bags to these wonderful people! Thanks to each and every one of you. https://t.co/TRWiB6TPmU

@ErinBrockovich We are trying everything... 5,899 calls in MARCH alone just about our local landfill to the @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency and we are still not been listened to. No one is taking this as seriously. Our lives are been ruined.
@StinkStopthe #StopTheStink #newcastleunderlyme

entity.name: Scandal
entity.description: Olivia Pope, a former media relations consultant to the president, is ready to move on with her life and opens her own crisis-management firm, but she can't seem to shake ties with her past. Pope's staff includes womaniser-turned-family man Stephen Finch, slick litigator Harrison Wright and hacker extraordinaire Huck. As she moves forward it becomes clear that while her staffers may specialise in cleaning up the lives of other people, they can't seem to do the same for themselves.

entity.name: Scandal
entity.description: Olivia Pope, a former media relations consultant to the president, is ready to move on with her life and opens her own crisis-management firm, but she can't seem to shake ties with her past. Pope's staff includes womaniser-turned-family man Stephen Finch, slick litigator Harrison Wright and hacker extraordinaire Huck. As she moves forward it becomes clear that while her staffers may specialise in cleaning up the lives of other people, they can't seem to do the same for themselves.

urls.title: 5 ways to avoid plastics when celebrating Eid - Preventing Plastic Pollution
urls.description: Coming together around the table and sharing food is a big part of celebrating Eid, so The Environment Agency have produced this poster sharing 5 easy ways to ditch avoidable plastics. From using loose leaf tea to avoid the tiny bits of plastic found in many teabags to doing away with single use plastic cutlery. This is the first in a series of three themed posters providing hints and tips on ways to reduce avoidable plastic waste, jointly created by the agency‚Äôs plastics and sustainability team, supported
